question: Blount Disease is involvement of
exp: Blount's disease is a progressive bow-leg deformity associated with abnormal growth of posterior-medial pa of proximal tibia. Ithas a triad: Internal Rotation of leg Tibia vara Hyperextension of the knee

question: 79 yrs old lady had fall, the following X-ray was taken. Which of the following is treatment?
exp: X-ray shows fracture in the neck of Femur. The treatment for neck of femur fracture is based on age: < 65 years old - Fixation > 65 years old- Hemiahroplasty Total hip replacement is done for ahritis of any age group. X- ray shows no ahritis. Nailing is used for shaft of femur fracture.

question: Triangular relation of elbow is maintained in:
exp: Triangular relation of elbow includes medial epicondyle, lateral epicondyle and tip of olecranon. The relationship is destroyed by dislocations of elbow. It is maintained in supracondylar fracture of Humerus (occurs above elbow joint)

question: Albers Schonberg disease is:
exp: Osteopetrosis is also called as "Marble bone Disease" and "Albers Schonberg Disease" Paget's disease is also known as osteitis deformans. Both Paget's and Osteopetrosis are osteoclast defect. Osteogenesis imperfecta is also known as brittle bone disease. Osteoporosisis known as porous bone.

question: Most common complication of extra capsular fracture of neck of femur is:
exp: Extra-capsular (inter-trochanteric) fracture is more common than intra-capsular. Most common complication of Extra-capsular fracture of neck of femur of neck is mal-union. In Intra-capsular (neck of femur fracture), the most common complication is avascular necrosis > non-union.

question: Adamantinoma affects
exp: Epithelial tumors are classified into Ameloblastoma and adamantinoma, though both the tumors show same type of histopathology, they are not interchangeable. Ameloblastoma Adamantinoma Site Mandible Tibia Most common site for Ameloblastoma is mandible Most common type of cancer of mandible is squamous cell carcinoma.

question: Primary osteoahritis affect all except:
exp: Osteoahritis involves DIP and PIP with sparing of MCP. Rheumatoid ahritis involves PIP and MCP with sparing of DIP. Osteoahritis commonly involves knee joint in India. Hip joint is rarely involved in osteoahritis.

question: In fracture of upper 1/3 of forearm, it is immobilized in:
exp: Immobilization of forearm at various fracture sites: ''SMP'' Upper 1/3rd- Supination Middle 1/3rd- Midprone Lower 1/3rd- Pronation

question: Which of the following statement about tubercular osteomyelitis is not true?
exp: Tuberculous osteomyelitis is a type of secondary osteomyelitis. Sequestrum is uncommon in tubercular osteomyelitis. Periosteal reaction is common in Osteomyelitis, but there is little or no periosteal reaction in tubercular osteomyelitis. * In tubercular osteomyelitis,Inflammation is rare.
opa: It is a type of secondary osteomyelitis

question: A child comes with limp and limb shoening.X-ray is given below, what is the diagnosis?
exp: X-ray show normal right side of hip joint.In left side of hip joint, the epiphysis is smaller,shallow acetabulum and the hip joint is dislocated- indicates Developmental Dysplasia of Hip (DDH). Pehes is avascular necrosis, seen in the proximal pa of the femur. SCFE is Slipped capital femoral epiphysis. Fracture of neck of femur is traumatic.

question: Most common site of osteomyelitis in children
exp: Overall Most common location of osteomyelitis is metaphysis. It is due to high vascularity, hair-pin loop system of blood supply, more prone to trauma and monocyte-macrophage system is weaker. Most common pa of osteomyelitis is lower end of Femur. Most common organism of osteomyelitis is staphylococcus aureus.

question: Tennis player can spontaneously reduce a shoulder dislocation. He can do it again and again himself. He is suffering from?
exp: Most common shoulder dislocation is Anterior type of shoulder dislocation which accounts for 95%. Since, it was mentioned that the player can reduce the dislocation "again and again", it could be a habitual type of dislocation which is recurrent. Acute shoulder dislocations are very painful which cannot be reduced or relocated again and again. Inferior type of shoulder dislocation usually presents with a characteristic"salute position" hence can be excluded.

question: A lady had a trauma to the neck. X-ray is attached. What is the diagnosis?
exp: Hangman's fracture is fracture of pars interaicularis of C2 and slip of C2 over C3 as shown in the image. Jefferson's fracture involves Atlas (C1). Clay shoveler fracture involves the spinous process of lower cervical spine. Sciwora usually occurs in children <8yrs old. It is a spinal cord injury without obvious radiological abnormality.

question: Patient had an injury to thumb causing thumb abduction. Which of the following can happen?
exp: Thumb abduction leads to ulnar collateral ligament damage. It is the most common injury of metacarpal phalangeal joint. Game keeper's thumb occurs due to forceful abduction of thumb. Mallet finger involves DIP of fingers and occurs due to hyperextension. Kaplan injury occurs in 2nd MCP joint as it is a flexion injury. Bowler's thumb occurs in bowling and there is nerve involvement.
